body.name: Lamson Big HotSpot Counter Protector/Large Potholder/Trivet, 11.5" x 11.5", Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 15 hrs 47 mins
features: Measures 11.5" by 11.5", is super flexible, heat resisitant to 450°F, and is BPA Free
The Jumbo Hotspot is the ultimate potholder, trivet, or jar opener! This is the most versatile item that Lamson has to offer. It is by far the best product to use to avoid any kitchen catastrophes!
They are exceptionally slip and skid resistant and dishwasher safe
Used in Professional Kitchens throughout the world
Functions as trivet, pot holder, anti-slip pad for mixing bowls, jar opener, garlic peeler
body.description: Product Description A fusion of artistry and functionality: Our knives and kitchen tools are created for expert chefs and home culinary enthusiasts alike. With designs as diverse as the professional and household needs we supply, Lamson products are at once high-performing and stylish, traditional and innovative. As we move toward a third century in a business we’ve long exemplified, our mission remains steadfast: to aim for nothing short of American-made perfection. Amazon.com This silicone countertop cover offers a resting spot for hot pots to keep Formica or Corian safe from melting or blistering. However, it also protects counterops from scratches; prevents mixing bowls and cutting boards from sliding during use; and functions as a pot holder, jar opener, and garlic peeler. Measuring 11-1/2 by 11-1/2 inches square, this trivet provides a large surface area that can fully cover the bottoms of most round or square casserole dishes. The silicone material is heat-resistant to 675 degrees Fahrenheit so heat wont transfer through the cover and a patterned surface keeps the trivet from slipping or sliding on any counter surface. This counter cover is flexible enough to roll up and store compactly in a drawer or has a hole in one corner to hang from a hook. This product is dishwasher-safe.--Cristina Vaamonde

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Lamson's Quality Cutlery and Kitchen Tools Since 1837 In 2002, Lamson introduced HotSpot silicone potholders, trivets and funnels, pioneering an area of technology now regarded as a staple of the modern kitchen. HotSpot is known as the best in the industry for its professional-grade heat resistant to 450 degrees.

About Lamson Lamson was established in Shelburne Falls, Massachusetts in 1837. As one of the oldest cutlery manufacturers in the United States, Lamson has been the choice of home and professional cooks as well as US Presidents for the last 179 years because of its high standard of craftsmanship. These traditions are true today not only in our cutlery and kitchen tools but in our barbeque equipment, TreeSpirit (Handcrafted North American Hardwood Kitchen Utensils and Wood Care Products) and HotSpot ( Professional Grade Silicone Potholders, Trivets, Hot Handles) products.

Lamson Silicone Product Features Made from medical-grade, FDA approved Easy to store in a drawer or cabinet Easy to store and super flexible Large variety of colors Carefree maintenance-just throw in the dishwasher Protect your furniture with dishwasher safe coasters The most versatile tool in the kitchen Trivet, jar opener, hot pan holder, non-slip surface, spoon rest, coaster, and garlic peeler

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good quality and finally got another black one. The size is convenient for pots and skillets and they look nice in the kitchen and are very easy to clean. Grandkids use them for sensory toys when I'm not looking!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Protects countertop from heat.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little mat. I've had one under my airfryer for a while and even cooking at 400° there's been no damage to the countertop. It's not flimsy and doesn't rip or tear. Cleans up quickly with soap and water. I am buying a second one for another appliance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice for top of toaster oven
reviews.reviewText: I’m using this on top of my toaster oven/air fryer deal so that I can put the knife block on it. It’s fantastic. It lays flat, blends in, and is nice and thick. It doesn’t even get hot or warm to the touch when I’m using the oven. It’s exactly what I was looking for. Definitely a good buy in my book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you have an air fryer, this is a good investment to keep your counters safe. It was recommended that we buy two, one for the fryer and one to set the basket on. Since I hadn't any experience with silicone trivets, I decided to buy only one. We were so happy with it, I ordered a second of the same one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works Good for Under My Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I just spent $7k on new quartz countertops and needed a silicone mat to protect them from the heat produced under my air fryer. I watched countless YouTube videos of people's air fryers causing their quartz countertops to crack. I was looking for something thicker than this model, but this is the only one that was the right size. My air fryer max temp is 400 degrees and this is rated to 450 degrees, so it does the job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lamson Silicone Mat Perfect for Under Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: We looked in the big box stores for a high-heat silicone mat to place on our countertops. Not finding what we wanted, we checked on Amazon. The description of this silicone mat and the size seemed perfect for our new Air Fryer. This was the perfect size for the Air Fryer and am now using it under my Instant Pot. The mat is easy to clean, easy to move forward when using appliance, and easy to clean. What an assurance to know that this mat will also protect our counter top from higher temperatures. This is a quality product that I would definitely purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This product is excellent quality and I've ordered quite a few more. It is perfect for the countertop to save from burns and scratches. I have the smaller size, but these work so much better if you are using them as a counter-saver. They are thick and heat-resistant and even large pans will fit on a single trivet. I used them to line my counters when cooking for the holidays and moving hot things in and out of the ovens. I use them every day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Large Cooking Vessels
reviews.reviewText: Nice deep color, the raised "bumps" on this silicone mat separate your hot cooking vessels from the table or counter tops. I purchased mine for Sous Vide cooking because I never felt very safe putting my large pot of hot water on an overturned baking pan... many people suggest the low (maybe 3/4 inch) sided baking sheets flipped over can be used for Sous Vide, but 1) It's not pretty and 2) The metal to metal contact between baking sheet and stainless steel pot is not secure if I should accidentally bump into it. It's a small price for a daily use item even if you don't have all the time in the world for Sous Vide cooking. You can use it to protect your surfaces when pulling any hot pan out of the oven or off your stove, or, if you are like me, any one of your Ninja cooking appliances.
É exatamente o que eu precisava. Excelente qualidade, fácil de limpar, ótimo para apoio das panelas ao lado do cook top.
This fits great under my air fryer on the counter.
me protege mis muebles de la fraedor de aire
Bought this for under my airfryer, does the job!
I bought this on a Warehouse Deal to use a small glassware drain pad next to the sink. Who knows, I may even use it as a trivet some day.
